Author: isthised
Text: Yeah thatâ€™s an eating disorder. Malnutrition can wreak all kinds of havoc at any weight. From one formerly obese person with an eating disorder to another, you deserve to seek treatment and help.

Author: ImNotUnique____
Text: If you are experiencing obsessive thoughts that take up a considerable portion of your day, and have tangible, measurable side effects like hair falling out and irregular heartbeat... I would say those are some pretty large indicators that there's a problem.    But! You can start fixing this. If you can go to the doctor for a check up, I highly recommend that as a starting place. It sounds like you may be malnourished (no matter what weight you're at, your body needs a whole slew of nutrients that it can't produce itself or store long term). Maybe try to factor in nutrient-heavy foods on days you do eat - an exam/blood test may help you figure out where you're deficient, or you can try to find a balance on your own but that is definitely more difficult/riskier. Your doctor may also be able to help you get in contact with someone for the mental health aspect, because obsessing over food and weight loss to a detrimental degree is not healthy for anyone.    I'm not a medical professional though, just a concerned stranger. However you choose to handle this I hope you end up in a happy and healthy place. ðŸ–¤
